title: Vedanta share price rises 5%. What’s driving the stock towards its 1-year high level?
description: Stock Market Today: Vedanta Ltd's share price rose over 5% in intraday trading, reaching  ₹504.75. The stock has gained over 10% in the last three sessions, driven by hopes of recovery in China's metals demand and rising base metal prices.
content: Stock Market Today: Vedanta Ltd share price gained more than 5% in intraday trades:Vedanta Ltd share price after opening slightly higher at  ₹485.45 on the BSE on Thursday, September 26 extended gains to hit the intraday high of  ₹504.75, marking a rise of more than 5% over its previous close. Notably, Vedanta share price has inched close to its one-year or 52-week high of  ₹506.85.Vedanta share price has gained more than 10% in the past three trading sessions.Here are the key reasons that drove Vedanta share price over 10% in the last three trading sessions and close to its one-year high:2. China demand recovery hopes- The hope of recovery in metals demand from China has risen significantly with multiple steps being taken by the world's largest consumer of commodities.In a bid to spur economic growth, China's central bank will cut banks' reserve requirement ratio (RRR) by 50 basis points, which is expected to release about 1 trillion yuan ($142.21 billion) for new lending. Moreover, the central bank is willing to lower the RRR by another 0.25-0.5 percentage points later this year if required. Additionally, to support the struggling real-estate market, they will lower interest rates on existing mortgages and reduce the minimum down payment for homes to 15%.3. Rising base metal prices- Aluminium prices on the London Metals Exchange (LME), which were trading at slightly over $2300 a tonne on September 11, have crossed the$2500 a tonne level. Copper prices have jumped from $8800 a tonne to $9600 a tonne during this period. Similarly, zinc and lead prices have risen more than 10% while others such as nickel are following suit. Furthermore, there are expectations of an uptick in steel prices too.The rising prices of base metals and steel improve Vedanta's earnings outlook.
